record.file.name: validity

brief.brief: The data type of the field.
The validity maintenance application populates this field automatically when adding a field. It does not validate on update.
The field type must be in-synch with the logical file for which the validity record is defined.

detail.detail: The validity validation routine extracts this value from dbdict of the table named in the Files/Formats field when validating the record. However, you can modify it manually.
Normally, manual maintenance is only required when a field's data type is changed in dbdict record.
If you change a field's data type, be sure to update the Values/Ranges to reflect the new data type. Update the appropriate database dictionary (dbdict) to reflect the correct data type.
Logoff of Service Manager and log back on to ensure that you are working with the most current version of the Database Dictionary utility.
Update the Values/Ranges definitions for the field whose data type has changed.
The value in the Field Type field is updated to reflect the new data type
